conclusion: The two objects meet when their displacement is the same.
The displacement is the area under the velocity-time graph.
For object A, the displacement is the area of the triangle from 0 to t2.
The area of the triangle for object A is 0.5 * t2 * v0.
For object B, the displacement is the area of the trapezoid from 0 to t4.
The area of the trapezoid for object B is 0.5 * (t4 - t2) * (v0 + v0) + 0.5 * t2 * v0.
Setting the two displacements equal: 0.5 * t2 * v0 = 0.5 * (t4 - t2) * (v0 + v0) + 0.5 * t2 * v0.
Simplifying the equation gives t2 = t4 - t2.
Solving for t2, we get t2 = t4/2.
The two objects meet at t2 = t4/2.
